author: undetermined
full_text:
Fact Check: Three-quarters false! These photos aren't of young PM Modi, President Murmu, Eknath Shinde

A set of four photos, supposedly showing four political figures in their youth, has been shared widely on social media. The photos purportedly feature Prime Minister Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, and Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde.

But do they?

AFWA found that only Adityanath's photo is authentic. The other three do not show the PM, the President, or the Maharashtra CM in their youth.

A sweeping lie
The first photo, supposedly showing a young Modi sweeping the floor, has long been debunked as photoshopped. Despite that, the photo crops up every now and then and has been doing so since Modi's run-up to the 2014 Lok Sabha elections.

The original photo, as per the Associated Press, was taken on June 2, 1946. And Modi was born on September 17, 1950. Per AP, it shows a man from an "untouchable" caste holding "the broom he uses in sweeping out streets, yards and houses." The photo was taken by Pulitzer Prize-winning American photographer Max Desfor.

Not Murmu, just a fan
The second photo is not a young Murmu. It is of Sukumar Tudu, a sanitation worker at a hospital in the Uparbeda village of Odisha — the village where Murmu was born. Sukumar was recently featured in a News 18 report on the president. Per the report, she, along with many others, danced and feasted the evening before Murmu was elected President.

Ek-Not
The photo of the man standing next to an autorickshaw is not of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, who used to be a rickshaw driver before rising through the ranks in Shiv Sena.

Reverse-searching the photo led us to the Facebook page "Maharashtra Rickshaw Panchayat Pune". According to this page, the photo shows Maharashtra Rickshaw Panchayat founder-president Baba Kamble.

AFWA reached out to Kamble, who said the photo was indeed his and was taken in 1997 during the Sawan celebration in Pimpri Chinchwad, Pune.

Kamble said that he used to be an autorickshaw driver and this image was from that time. He added that he was recently interviewed by Lokmat and the report carried this photo. Following that, the photo went viral as that of Shinde.

He told AFWA, "People confused me with Shinde because of my beard and the association with the rickshaw. The image was also posted on my organisation's Facebook page along with the clarification that it isn't Eknath's image."

The only right one
The fourth photo is the only one that was correctly identified. It belongs to UP CM Adityanath. The image was carried in a photo story by Amar Ujala in August 2020.
title: Only Yogi Adityanath’s photo is authentic. The other three photos do not show the PM, the President, or the Maharashtra CM.
vclaim: A viral set of four photos claiming to show young versions of PM Modi, President Murmu, CM Eknath Shinde, and CM Yogi Adityanath is mostly false, with only Adityanath's photo being authentic. The photo claimed to be of young Modi sweeping the floor is actually a 1946 photograph of an "untouchable" caste man, taken by photographer Max Desfor. The supposed young photo of President Murmu is actually of Sukumar Tudu, a sanitation worker from her native village in Odisha. The auto-rickshaw driver photo claimed to be of CM Eknath Shinde is actually of Baba Kamble, founder-president of Maharashtra Rickshaw Panchayat, taken in 1997. Only the photo of UP CM Yogi Adityanath is genuine among the four viral images.
